net.uniform.impl

Class AbstractForm

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.uniform.impl.AbstractForm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Form
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HTMLForm

    public abstract class AbstractForm
extends Object
implements Form
    Abstract form implementation that contains all generic logic that any form should have.
    Author:
    Eduardo Ramos

      If the element class or superclasses decorators has been explicitely set with Form.addDefaultDecoratorForElementClass(java.lang.Class, net.uniform.api.Decorator), this returns a list of decorators, otherwise returns null.

      Returns the default decorators set for the given element class.

      Does the same as Form.getFormDataConvertedToElementValueTypes() but automatically sets any matching bean property to the given object, by looking at the each property name and type class.

      Form populate(Map<String,List<String>> formData)
      Clears data and validation status (like Form.reset()) from all elements in the form and populates them by name calling their populate method.
      Form populate(Map<String,List<String>> formData, boolean keepOtherValues)
      Clears data and validation status (like Form.reset()) from all elements in the form only if keepOtherValues is false, and populates them by name calling their populate method.
      Form populateBean(Object bean)
      Does the same as Form.populateSimple(java.util.Map) but automatically extracting all accessible bean properties from the given object.
      Form populateBean(Object bean, boolean keepOtherValues)
      Does the same as Form.populateSimple(java.util.Map, boolean) but automatically extracting all accessible bean properties from the given object.
      Form populateSimple(Map<String,?> formData)
      Clears data and validation status (like Form.reset()) from all elements in the form and populates them by name calling their populate method.
      Form populateSimple(Map<String,?> formData, boolean keepOtherValues)
      Clears data and validation status (like Form.reset()) from all elements in the form only if keepOtherValues is false, and populates them by name calling their populate method.

      • addElement

        public Form addElement(Element element,
                       boolean useDefaultDecorators)
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Adds an element to the form. The element id should be unique in the form. Default decorators are added to the element if it does not have any decorator, default decorators are defined for its class, and useDefaultDecorators parameter is true. Default renderer is set to the element if it does not have a renderer, and a default renderer is defined for its class.
        Specified by:
        addElement in interface Form
        Parameters:
        element - Element to add
        useDefaultDecorators - Indicates if default decorators should be taken into account when adding the element
        Returns:
        This form

      • addElement

        public Form addElement(Element element)
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Adds an element to the form. The element id should be unique in the form. Default decorators are added to the element if it does not have any decorator, and default decorators are defined for its class. Default renderer is set to the element if it does not have a renderer, and a default renderer is defined for its class.
        Specified by:
        addElement in interface Form
        Parameters:
        element - Element to add
        Returns:
        This form

      • startDecorator

        public Form startDecorator(String id,
                           Decorator decorator)
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Starts a form decorator that will be applied to any HTML tags produced between this and the corresponding call to Form.endDecorator() method. Form decorators can be nested. You can start a decorator within another decorator, and you can add any number of elements (even none) between the call to startDecorator and endDecorator.
        Specified by:
        startDecorator in interface Form
        Parameters:
        id - Decorator id
        decorator - Decorator to start
        Returns:
        This form

      • endDecorator

        public Form endDecorator()
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Ends the current open decorator. Form decorators can be nested.
        Specified by:
        endDecorator in interface Form
        Returns:
        This form.

      • getValidationErrors

        public Map<String,List<String>> getValidationErrors()
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Returns any the validation errors in the form indexed by element id. It also includes the form level validation errors in the null key, if any.
        Specified by:
        getValidationErrors in interface Form
        Returns:
        Index of validation errors, may be empty. Will only contain keys for elements with errors

      • getFormDataMultivalue

        public Map<String,List<String>> getFormDataMultivalue()
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Returns the values of all the form elements as lists of strings. Data is indexed by element name (normally the same as the element id).
        Specified by:
        getFormDataMultivalue in interface Form
        Returns:
        Form data as list of string values.

      • getFormData

        public Map<String,Object> getFormData()
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Returns the values of all the form elements as strings or lists of strings (dependin on each element isMultiValue). Data is indexed by element name (normally the same as the element id).
        Specified by:
        getFormData in interface Form
        Returns:
        Form data as a string or list of string values.

      • getFormDataConvertedToElementValueTypes

        public Map<String,Object> getFormDataConvertedToElementValueTypes()
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Returns the values of all the form elements as their target value type. Conversion for simple types is done by the form, according to the element getValueType() method. Complex type conversion can also be done by elements implementing the ElementWithValueConversion interface. Data is indexed by element name (normally the same as the element id).
        Specified by:
        getFormDataConvertedToElementValueTypes in interface Form
        Returns:
        Form data as any target type.

      • populate

        public Form populate(Map<String,List<String>> formData)
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Clears data and validation status (like Form.reset()) from all elements in the form and populates them by name calling their populate method. Input data must be a list of Strings or null for every element with a value.
        Specified by:
        populate in interface Form
        Parameters:
        formData - Form data indexed by element name
        Returns:
        This form

      • populate

        public Form populate(Map<String,List<String>> formData,
                     boolean keepOtherValues)
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Clears data and validation status (like Form.reset()) from all elements in the form only if keepOtherValues is false, and populates them by name calling their populate method. Input data must be a list of Strings or null for every element with a value.
        Specified by:
        populate in interface Form
        Parameters:
        formData - Form data indexed by element name
        keepOtherValues - True to keep values of elements not specified in the formData parameter
        Returns:
        This form

      • populateSimple

        public Form populateSimple(Map<String,?> formData)
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Clears data and validation status (like Form.reset()) from all elements in the form and populates them by name calling their populate method. Input data can be any type for each element, or null. If the object for an element is an array or collection, it is converted to a list of Strings, otherwise it is converted to a single String.
        Specified by:
        populateSimple in interface Form
        Parameters:
        formData - Form data indexed by element name
        Returns:
        This form

      • populateSimple

        public Form populateSimple(Map<String,?> formData,
                           boolean keepOtherValues)
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Clears data and validation status (like Form.reset()) from all elements in the form only if keepOtherValues is false, and populates them by name calling their populate method. Input data can be any type for each element, or null. If the object for an element is an array or collection, it is converted to a list of Strings, otherwise it is converted to a single String.
        Specified by:
        populateSimple in interface Form
        Parameters:
        formData - Form data indexed by element name
        keepOtherValues - True to keep values of elements not specified in the formData parameter
        Returns:
        This form

        Specified by:
        populateBean in interface Form
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This form

      • populateBean

        public Form populateBean(Object bean,
                         boolean keepOtherValues)
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Does the same as Form.populateSimple(java.util.Map, boolean) but automatically extracting all accessible bean properties from the given object.
        Specified by:
        populateBean in interface Form
        Parameters:
        bean - Bean object
